title: Michelle Payne attends the Caulfield Guineas Day in Melbourne
text:
She made history as the first Australian female jockey to win the Melbourne Cup in 2015.

But on Saturday, Michelle Payne swapped her riding gear for a stunning dress as she attended the Caulfield Guineas Day in Melbourne.

The 34-year-old dressed to impress as she flaunted her trim waist and toned legs in a white ruffled mini frock.

White on the mark! Jockey Michelle Payne (pictured) flaunted her trim waist in a ruffled mini dress at the Caulfield Guineas Day in Melbourne

The stylish figure-hugging dress sat off-the-shoulder and consisted of floral detailing and loose sleeves.

Michelle opted to accessorise the stylish ensemble with a purple coloured fascinator which complimented the dress' pattern.

She styled her brunette locks in a simple half up half down hairdo while ensuring her headpiece remained the focus.

Style: Michelle dressed to impress in an off-the-shoulder frock complete with floral detailing and loose sleeves

The Melbourne Cup winner also wore a pair of statement earrings and carried all her essentials in a blush pink shoulder bag.

She held a pair of sunglasses in her hands for when she needed to shield herself from the sun.

Michelle was seen enjoying the horse race from the sidelines alongside her group of friends.

Display: Michelle opted to accessorise the stylish ensemble with a purple coloured fascinator and statement earrings

In 2015, Michelle made history when she became the first female to win the annual Melbourne Cup race.

Her inspiring story lead to the creation of the film, Ride Like A Girl, which hit cinemas last month.

Actress Teresa Palmer played the role of Michelle in the film which has been labelled as 'captivating and emotional' by critics.

authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
